name: Cuco Valoy
description: '''Cuco Valoy'''  (born January 6, 1937, in [[Manoguayabo, Santo Domingo]], Dominican Republic) is a Dominican Republic singer, songwriter, percussionist and guitarist, who is versatile in [[salsa music|salsa]], [[son montuno]], [[guaracha]] and [[merengue music|merengue]]. He began performing with his brother Martín, under the name Los Ahijados. Valoy is the father of [[Ramón Orlando]], with whom he formed the band Los Virtuosos, later changed to La Tribu. He is widely known for the song "Juliana", which was covered by the group [[Dark Latin Groove|DLG]]; a cover that featured Valoy's vocals.
